channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrown vegetation, 28th August
item.description:
Brambles are sticking our over the pavement which forces pedestrians into the cycle lane. Not sure who is responsible for ensuring these are cut back sufficiently to avoid scratching pedestrians, especially children (in pushchairs) who are in danger of being scratched in the face.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drains, 26th August
item.description:
Water covers footpath where drains are blocked from Newlands traffic lights to roundabout. This forces pedestrians to walk oin the road which is a very busy 40mph road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hyde Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Abandoned shopping trolley in Montpellier Villas Road, 24th August
item.description:
This shopping trolley has been dumped in Daniel Keenanâ€™s forecourt in Montpellier Villas. There are no markings to indicate which supermarket/shop it has been taken from.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Montpellier Villas, Montpellier, Cheltenham

item.title: Drain clearance, 24th August
item.description:
A drain opposite the school was recently cleared but the debris was dumped on the grass verge that is now killing the grass and looking unsightly
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Battledown Approach, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are five potholes at the junction of Montpellier Villas and Suffolk Road., 24th August
item.description:
These potholes have been here for over six months and have gradually deteriorated. These are dangerous because vehicles turning into Montpellier Villas cannot avoid them because cars are parked on both sides of the road which leaves hardly any room to manoeuvre especially if there is an oncoming car travelling along Montpellier Villas towards the Suffolk Road junction.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Montpellier Villas, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Long white paint line on road, 24th August
item.description:
There is an approx. 40 meters long and 15 cm wide white paint line that must have been spilled from a burst can on a passing car. It runs from the corner of Wellington Road and Pitville Lawn towards Pitville Circus. It's not likely to fade out, unless someone removes it with the appropriate solvent and equipment.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Christchurch Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Reserving parking space with bins or cones by residents of 7, Duke Street, 22nd August
